cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi SSE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to curve north, then northeast, skirting the coasts of South and North Carolina before moving back over the Atlantic toward the Mid-Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the SC/NC border (close to Myrtle Beach – Cape Fear area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to south of South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River SC to Cape Lookout NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Carolina and North Carolina coasts, especially from Edisto Beach to Cape Lookout including Wilmington
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible, gusts 40–60 mph, beginning overnight Saturday and lasting through Sunday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft above ground level possible at high tide; minor coastal inundation around Cape Fear and lower Cape Fear River
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated pockets up to 6 inches could cause localized flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents likely along area beaches
